page.lettertext:
fol.353r
2 Novem
b
To my L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
good L. being charged againe
by my
LL.
of
e Councel, to send away
e troupe
of
S
r
Nicholas Parker
, I have sent heere inclosed mine
answear unto them: w
ch
yo
r
L. will vouchesafe
to accompany w
t
suche mater, as I have formerly
signified, and to certifie my care, to accomplishe
whatsoever is required at my handes. Sins I writte
my last unto yo
r
L.
e 25 of Oc
t
S
r
Thomas Shirleis
Deputie hath send me worde,
at
e shippers of
Ze-
land
doe flatly refuse to be hired for
Jerdsey
:
for w
ch
he should be forced to repaire into
England
,
for some further direction. By whome I humbly
beseeche yow,
at I may by
order
letter
be advertised, w
at
orders are sette downe. I shall be able thereby
both to notifie
e same, when I deale w
t
e states
w
ch
I could not doe hitherto (for
at
my
mine owne
I have no
instructions
were alwaies
but onely
for
Caen
) and likewise to S
r
Nicholas
Parker, and give him for many thinges a sounder
addresse. For otherwise as nowe, I am nether in-
formed in time
c
o
venient
of suche alterations nor in particular
maner, and by privat letters onely, w
t
out war-
rant sufficient to proceede upon it. The
Coun-
cel of Estate
hath made a newe propositi
o
to
e
generall states, to
e self same effect, as they did
e last yere, for
e raising of o
r
extraordinary
c
o
tributi
o
of 90 thous
a
d poundes sterling, to be
i
-
ploied
e next
yer
s
o
mer
in
e service of
e c
o
trey.
For this they promise to leavie 3000 footm
e
and
three or 400 h
u
dred horse.
Am
o
g their other inducem
e
ts to w
i
ne
e people to
their purpose, they
allege
alleage
e w
t
drawing
of these troupes of her Ma
tie
. The
posti
o
is
made to
e ass
e
blie
at is heere,
but
a
d
is by
th
e
to be presented to every several Province.
but by c
o
m
o
c
o
jecture it will not be resolved these 2 or 3 monethes.
&c.
